Description: Stone ring made of schist, flat on upper and lower surface, upper part much better smoothed. The perforation in the centre is more or less round, with a small part that has been chipped off. Other parts at the edges chipped off at both sides. Some areas show small traces of shaping the object into its shape. Small part of the upper side covered in salt crystals. May have been used as pot stand.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 148)
